result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:42 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Mollie P Peck appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Mollie P Peck.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on the status of the case.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:12 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Mollie P Peck appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Mollie P Peck.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Erickson is heard on status of this case - requests status hearing
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:32 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Mollie P Peck appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Mollie P Peck.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard. Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Erickson is heard and ready to proceed with Arraignment. 
Information filed. 

Atty Erickson is heard and waives further formal reading of the information as it mirrors the formal complaint. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.  

Atty Erickson is heard on bond. Requests a signature bond. 
Court addresses the defendant. No change in bond.
Jury status hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Jeffrey Warren Erickson

2:35 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Mollie P Peck appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Mollie P Peck. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Inmate request to Judge Rider and Judge Rider's 6/8/22 response to same

1:39 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Mollie P. Peck appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeffrey W Erickson appears by video for the defendant. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond.  State requests a $1,000.00 cash bond.  Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with J Bullis. Defendant shall have no contact with C. Khaokaew.

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with J Bullis.  Defendant shall have no contact with C. Khaokaew.

Attorney Erickson is heard on the status of defendant being eligible for a public defender. 
Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with J Bullis.  Defendant shall have no contact with C. Khaokaew.
